Fields.DialogueText: Captain, why must we wait for the Morganas to make a move? Let's bring the battle to them!
I love your enthusiasm, Orion, but facing an unknown enemy is reckless.
I don't need to know my enemy to sink them.
True - but act too impetuously, and you'll be the one who finds herself at the bottom of the sea.
You would rather let the Morganas kill our allies instead of bringing the fight to them?
That's not the choice we're discussing. I don't want you and the crew to throw your lives away in disorganized charges.
Oh? I didn't realize you cared so much for us all, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: What good is a captain who has no consideration for ship and crew?
Well, I care for some of you more than I do for others.
I care that my reputation would be ruined if I lost a Belle to recklessness!

Fields.DialogueText: No better than a captain who waits for the enemy to make a move.
You flatter me, Captain - but if you care for me, then perhaps you should agree to search out the enemy instead of sitting here, waiting.
How damaged would your reputation be if you lost a Belle to overcaution?
*ALARM*
Looks like my caution has led to us having a battle at a place of our choosing. Go figure.
... This discussion isn't over. It is merely being postponed by the gift of battle.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Captain?
Let's get a little closer before the shooting starts. We won't hit anything at this range.
Agreed.
@BATTLE
We hardly had time to prepare for that last battle. Do you now see the value of caution, Orion?
Perhaps your way of thinking has some merits, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Why else would I have been made captain?
For now. A time may come where we have to do things your way.
Perhaps now you'll see how foolish it is to disagree with me.

Fields.DialogueText: Surely it wasn't just because of your pretty face.
I eagerly look forward to the day you let me have my way.
All I see is a captain who will learn, eventually, that caution doesn't win wars.
... Would you care to rephrase that?
My apologies, Captain. With your permission, I'll take my leave now.
It's my fault, Orion. I'm the captain and I set the tone for our interactions. You're dismissed.
Captain, I must reiterate my apology from earlier.
There is no need to do that. We're both still new to this partnership, after all.
Yes, and it can be a little overwhelming to be surrounded by so many cute boys in uniform.
I'm sure the male members of our crew would prefer to be called men.
But they are all so inexperienced. Compared to the wealth of knowledge I've collected over the years, they are veritable schoolchildren.
You Belles do have quite a bit of insight to share. No one would argue that point.
Heh... Captain?
Yes?
Do you think I'm cute?

Fields.MenuText: No cuter than a younger sibling constantly pestering me to play with them.
Who wouldn't think so? Isn't it obvious?
For future reference, this is the look on my face immediately before I change a topic of conversation. You might want to remember it.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmph! A younger sibling. Is that how you see me Captain?
You flatter me, Captain. Don't stop. Tell me more about how cute I am.
No fun, Captain.
*ALARM*
Orion, we're under attack! Get to your station!
Whew! That was remarkably well-timed.
@BATTLE
The ocean is so calm now. It's striking, considering we were at battle not that long ago.
... I'm just waiting for the damn klaxon to sound. Morganas are usually pretty good at killing moods like this.
Do you think the world will calm as well, once this war is finally won?

Fields.MenuText: I believe it will. After all, bringing peace to the world is why I signed up for the military.
I have no idea. But I hope we'll both be there to see it, if so.
Sure it will... until the next threat comes along to disrupt that peace.

Fields.DialogueText: That seems a little contradictory, Captain.
Surviving that long might be an impossibility, but I hope so as well, Captain.
That may be true. If so, we'll just need to enjoy the peace as long as it lasts.
It almost seems funny that a captain and warship are discussing peace.
You might not understand this, but just because I am good at defeating enemy ships doesn't mean I enjoy it.
I understand how that could be true.
*ALARM*
Why must they keep attacking? Do they not value their lives, Captain?
I have no idea. Either way, our response is the same. To battle stations!
Yes, Captain!
@BATTLE
Orion, what are those letters you have?
I've seen you carrying them around the ship.
These? They are simply letters from my many admirers.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not surprised. You are one of the most powerful Belles in this war.
In that case, I would have expected the bundle to be twice as large.
I wasn't aware of the extent of others' admiration for you.

Fields.DialogueText: Is my strength and battle prowess all you see when you look at me?
If you weren't the captain, would you write me a letter?
Really? Had the thought never even crossed your mind?
Sorry to intrude, Captain, but there's a shortage of potatoes in the galley.
I'd better get going. Excuse me, Orion.
.... To see to potatoes? Why would that require the Captain's attention?
Unless the Captain was avoiding my question!
*ALARM*
I guess my answer will have to wait.
@BATTLE
There's a... are you saying potatoes have gone missing? In bulk?
Less "missing," more "crushed." I don't have the full story, though, Captain - I was just sent to....
Got it.
Orion, I'm glad I found you. I think you dropped this.
My missing letter! Thank you so much, Captain!
You're welcome, although I didn't think you would be so excited to get a simple letter back.
There is nothing simple about this letter, Captain. This is a love letter.
And love is hardly ever simple.
Have you ever been in love, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: Yes. But things didn't work out so well.
I might be right now, but I'm not sure if the object of my affection feels the same way.
I'm not sure I've ever had the time.

Fields.DialogueText: At least you were in love once. Do you think I could say the same thing, Captain?
Well, then, you should probably ask!
If all you do is wage war, then how much is your life truly worth?
Well, the thing is...
*ALARM*
Must the Morganas always attack whenever we try to have a conversation?
I'm not sure, but we can discuss that after the battle.
@BATTLE
Excuse me - are you the crewman who found Orion's letter?
Yes, Captain! I found it in the control room.
Did you happen to read the letter?
No, Captain. Although I did try. The pages were all blank!
Blank pages? You mean there was nothing written in the letter?
Yes, Captain. All three pages were completely blank.
*ALARM*
Return to your station, and be sure to speak of this to no one.
@BATTLE
Captain, you wanted to see me?
I wanted to give you a reward for doing so well in today's battle.
Oooh! I like the sound of that! What is it?

Fields.MenuText: Here is a new ribbon to tie your letters together with. I'd hate to see more of them lost about the ship.
Here is a small cedar box. You can put your letters in there and never fear dropping them again.
Here is a string. Tie up your letters tighter from now on.

Fields.DialogueText: This is such a pretty color! Thank you so much, Captain.
This is so thoughtful, Captain. Thank you!
Yes, Captain. I am sorry if my letters were a problem.
Keep up the good work, Orion.
Orion, do you know what day it is?
... Is this a trick question?
No, Orion. Today is the day we take the fight to the Morganas.
Is it really, Captain? Are we really making a preemptive attack?
Yes. I've been in communication with Command, and they've ordered us to seek out a specific Morgana fleet. We're not far from them, now.
Ah, I can't wait!
@BATTLE
I've never seen you so fierce, Orion. Perhaps there is something to be said about going on the offensive.
Indeed there is, Captain! In fact, I think I can track down some other Morganas if you would like to keep on the offensive.

Fields.MenuText: That might not be the best move, despite how well the battle went today.
Aren't you worried about putting yourself in harm's way?
Feel free to track down as many as you want, but I'll need to check with Command before we engage.

Fields.DialogueText: Even when things go well, you continue to act cautiously.
Thank you for your concern. I will keep myself out of trouble.
Oh, this is exciting!
Captain! I have found several Morgana ships ripe for an attack.
Excellent work, Orion. I'll go over your report and take that information to Command.
By that time, the Morganas might have moved out of reach. We need to act now.

Fields.MenuText: Must I remind you about the folly of recklessness?
I'd just as soon not risk blundering into someone else's operation by accident. No harm in checking.
I've got my orders, too, Orion. Absent imminent threat to civilian traffic or coastal communities, we observe until otherwise necessary.

Fields.DialogueText: Must I remind you that caution won't win the war?
I think we'd notice if there was another operation going on, Captain.
Just having them out here constitutes an imminent threat!
Despite what you say, I am responsible for everyone on this ship. I can't just order an attack on a whim.
It's not a whim - it's based on good intelligence. Don't you trust me?
Yes, I trust you. However, I don't trust the Morganas and can't help but feel like they're planning something.
Perhaps they are, which is why we need to attack before they can enact their plan.
We will engage with the weakest Morgana you've identified so far...
Yes!
After I've checked in with Command.
Good grief - you're no fun.
@BATTLE
Captain, I brewed some fresh tea and was wondering if you would like to join me in a cup.
I'd love a cup, but where could you possibly have found fresh tea out here on the ocean?
I'd love to tell you, but a girl has to have some secrets. Sugar?

Fields.MenuText: No, thank you, I'm not much for sweets.
Just one lump. I like a little sweetness in my tea.
As much sugar as it takes to hide the taste of the tea.

Fields.DialogueText: I can appreciate a man who likes to taste the tea itself.
I like a little sweetness with my tea too. That's why I asked you to join me.
I never suspected that you might have a sweet tooth, Captain.
This tea does taste exceptional. If you have any more, I'd be glad to share another pot with you in the future.
Well, then, I'll be sure to pick some more up next time we make it to port.
A few crewmen did report seeing you on the dock at night, the last time we made port. Is that true?
Perhaps...
You are one secretive lady, Orion.
So, I'm a lady, now? Here I thought I was just a Belle to you.
Well, then - I owe you an apology for making you feel that way.
*ALARM*
What a shame. The rest of my tea is going to get cold.
@BATTLE
Captain, how would you feel about having a dog on board?
A dog? Why do you want one?
Well, he could hunt down the mice on board. Keep them from eating our rice.
That's why we have the cat. Which I'm sure the dog would attack before the mice.
Well, we could train a dog to protect the brig.
I don't think there's much danger of the occasional drunk and disorderly sailor staging a breakout.
So, are you saying you don't want a dog on board?

Fields.MenuText: No, but I don't think we need one.
No, I'd love to have a dog. You just need to work on your arguments.
Yes. I'm sorry, but dogs have no use on a ship.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe, you're right. I'll just take this puppy back home.
Well, this little guy likes my arguments just fine.
Does this puppy really need a use to be on the ship?
Oh. My. That is... a very cute puppy.
I knew you would love him! I named him Cappy. After you, of course!
Do you really think I'm that easy to manipulate? Really?
Look at Cappy's little face and tell me I was wrong.
@BATTLE
... I'm not the one who's going to be stuck cleaning up after him. Let's make that very clear.
Orion, I've been meaning to ask you something.
What is it, Captain? What's on your mind?
Did you pick Cappy up on the docks? Like you did your tea?
Now, now, Captain. You know I like to have my secrets.
I'll find out eventually, you can't keep secrets on a ship forever.
*WOOF, WOOF!*
What is it, Cappy? What's wrong?
Look to port - a Morgana's heading right for us!
... Yeah. I'm not going to let the lookouts live this down anytime soon.
@BATTLE
Did you really doubt that Cappy would be useful on board?
Perhaps at first.

Fields.MenuText: But he's a great companion to have on the lonely nights.
But he's proven himself to be a great little cat chaser.
I thought he was going to wind up as just another mouth to feed.

Fields.DialogueText: Are you that in need of companionship, Captain? How sad.
It seems like he takes after you in more than just his name.
Well, that much is true. He does need food.
Always honest, aren't you, Orion?
Captain, look what I picked up in port! Oolong tea - it's one of my sister's favorites.
It smells fantastic... did you say sister?
Well, technically Perth is my half sister. Why do you look surprised?

Fields.MenuText: I just haven't heard you talk about her.
Not surprised. Just... how do you think she's doing these days?
You'll have to excuse me. It's just still strange to hear warships talk about their family members.

Fields.DialogueText: You haven't asked!
She's all right. I think. Changing names was hard for her, but she seems to like being Australian.
Well, you'd better get used to it. A lot of us Belles have sisters.
There is still so much we don't know about you Belles. Perhaps you could share more with me sometime.
I would if I knew anything you didn't already know. The particulars of our own existences are a little out of reach, even for us.
Are you sure this isn't another lady secret you refuse to share with me?
No. Believe me, I wish I knew more about the Belles myself.
*ALARM*
Ah, well.
@BATTLE
So, are you ever going to make that oolong tea, Orion?
We started talking about my sister and the Belles and it just slipped my mind. I'll go do so right now.
Excuse me, Captain, but have you seen Lady Orion?
She just went to go boil some tea. Why do you ask, sailor?
Could you give her this package, Captain? I have to get back to my post.
Sure. Do you have any idea what's in the package?
Not sure, Captain. My best guess, based on the smell, is that it is another package of tea leaves.
You have a good nose. Dismissed, sailor!

Fields.MenuText: This package was dropped off for you, although I have no idea how it was delivered onto this ship.
This package came for you, Orion. Does this have anything to do with one of your secrets?
So, the big secret was that someone drops the tea off for you.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, it seems like you found out half of my secret, Captain. But I'll never reveal who delivers the tea.
The secret isn't the tea's arrival, but who delivers the tea.
No, the big secret is who is doing the dropping off, Captain.
*ALARM*
The mystery will have to wait.
@BATTLE
I'm back! Did I miss anything?
Cappy? Cappy, come here, boy!
Captain, have you seen Cappy lately? It seems like I haven't seen him in hours.
I was just looking for him, myself. Can't you feel where he is within the ship?
If he was somewhere isolated, I could. But if he's surrounded by sailors, it becomes harder to pinpoint him.
Those are certainly some supernatural senses you have, Orion.
A shame they aren't currently doing me any good.
*WOOF, WOOF!*
There you are, boy! Where have you been hiding and... what is that in your mouth?
Oh, no. My Bermuda Easter Lilies!
*WHIMPER*
And welcome to the downside of having a dog in enclosed spaces.
It's not his fault. He's probably just hungry for something other than slop.

Fields.MenuText: That's no excuse for his behavior. I'll replace the flowers somehow.
Okay. Fair point. If I'd known Bermuda Easter Lillies were a menu option last night...
I could always send him to the brig.

Fields.DialogueText: You don't have to, Captain, but I do appreciate the thought.
Ha. I could picture you with flowers hanging out of your mouth like Cappy.
Do that, and his whining will drive the entire crew to madness.
*WOOF, WOOF! GRR...*
It looks like the Morganas are at it again. Good job, Cappy.
I guess that makes up for the flowers.
@BATTLE
Nothing serious. I just thought you might like some oolong tea.
Oh. Thank you! I never had a chance to try it the last time you made it.
Y'know, I don't think I've ever been in your quarters before.
Is it not what you expected?

Fields.MenuText: Actually, I have no idea what I expected to find in here.
To be honest, I never gave it a lot of thought. But this is certainly not what I expected.
No, this seems just about right. Lots of gold and pale green colors.

Fields.DialogueText: What, you don't have an ounce of imagination?
The crewmen who make my deliveries say the same thing.
It's so relaxing, isn't it, Captain?
You're so tough, Orion. I guess I thought the room might seem a little more... intimidating.
Even tough women can be girls at heart, Captain. Should I be any different?
No, I guess not.
*ALARM*
Sounds as if my quest for tea has been thwarted again.
@BATTLE
Orion? I got your invitation - though it's not really clear what I'm invited to...
Orion, why do you carry those letters around with you everywhere?
I told you - these are letters from my admirers. They are close to my heart.
I didn't want to bring this up before, but... that letter you lost earlier was blank.
You tried to read my letter? Surely you realize that's a gross invasion of privacy!
I didn't have to try to read it to see that it was--
*ALARM*
Their timing just keeps getting worse.
@BATTLE
I think I owe you an apology, Captain. I shouldn't have become so upset with you. You are the captain, after all.
That doesn't mean your correspondence is any of my business. I'm sorry I butted in.
No, it's all right. The truth is... all these letters at my waist are blank. I've never received a single love letter.
How is that possible? I know many of the crewmen spend hours writing you love letters and poems.
They write me letters, but they don't love me. Not truly. They don't even know me. These letters remind me of what I am missing, and of what I want more than anything in this world.

Fields.MenuText: Thank you for sharing that with me, Orion. I hope you get your love letter one day soon.
You need to do more than hope for love if you ever hope to achieve it.
Perhaps you should get to know these men who write you. Then you might find love.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Captain.
You just might be right. Perhaps I need to be more active in my search for love.
I've never thought of it that way...
It seems like the Morganas are getting stronger every time we face them.
I doubt we would have lasted this long against them if it wasn't for you Belles.
During our time fighting the Morganas, I've witnessed your human spirit first hand. Even without our help, I wouldn't count you out.
That's a kind thing to say... even if we both know humanity wouldn't stand a chance.
Perhaps it was because of your human spirit that we Belles came to defend you in the first place.

Fields.MenuText: Or perhaps you just pitied us.
You Belles have some connection to the planet. I was joking about you as though you're not... individuals, I guess. You deserve better.
Or else you're planning on taking the planet over yourselves, once the Morganas have been defeated.

Fields.DialogueText: Sometimes. But that's hardly reason to put our lives on the line to fight with you.
But what is this planet without humanity?
I do hope that was a joke, Captain.
Once again, it seems as if I know less about the Belles than you give me credit for, Orion.
@BATTLE
You'll pick it up. Of that I'm reasonably certain.
Orion, I think I should apologize for our last talk. I still don't know that much about the Belles, and sometimes I speak out of turn.
You don't need to say anything, Captain. I realize how strange it must have been when we suddenly showed up.
"Strange" isn't... a big enough word. I've met enough of you by now to trust you, though. Even if I don't know how you came to be here.
Blind trust is rarely advisable, Captain. In this case, your beloved caution serves you well.
*ALARM*
Speak of the devils. These damn Morganas never let up!
@BATTLE
Those Morganas should be getting weaker, but it seems like every time we face them they are even stronger.
I wish I had that kind of ability. It's hard not to feel fatigued after a while.
And it doesn't look as if the fight will let up any time soon...
As long as I get to remain near you, I'll gladly continue the good fight.

Fields.MenuText: I'm happy to have you by my side.
I... I don't know what to say, Orion.
Please don't say that. I'm not worth your suffering.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad to hear it.
You're so cute when you get flustered. That's why I love being here with you.
You have no idea of your worth to me, Captain. But I hope to show you, one day.
Captain, Cappy seems so restless lately. I wish we could take him somewhere to run around.
I couldn't agree more... which is why it's so convenient that we're dropping anchor by that nearby island. We can give him a chance to run like a maniac on dry land.
You realize I can't go too far from the ship, right?
I know. We'll stay close to shore - don't worry.
Well, then, I'll go get some sandwiches and a few drinks! This ought to be fun!
*SOME TIME LATER*
*WOOF, WOOF!*
He looks so happy. Thank you for making this stop, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Well, he isn't the only one who looks happy. You seem to be enjoying yourself as well.
To be honest, I needed to step foot on actual land as much as Cappy. No offense, but man wasn't meant to be at sea all day.
We can't stay here long, but I knew it would make everyone feel better.

Fields.DialogueText: I've always liked spending time on land. This warm sand feels wonderful!
Considering the number of crew members who've been seasick on board, I'm well aware of man's preference for land.
And we all thank you, immensely.
*WOOF, WOOF! GRR...*
What did you find, Cappy?
What is it? Are you hurt? Wait, you're screaming about... this little crab? Ha!
I hate crabs! And are you laughing at me?
*GRR... WOOF!*
Is it another crab, boy?
No, Captain, those are Morganas on the horizon.
Great.
@BATTLE
Aaaaaa! Help me, Captain! Save me!!!
I've never seen you quite so... wrathful in battle, Orion. Something wrong?
Those damn Morganas ruin every good moment we have. Why can't we have just one day without them showing up?
I do know that we shouldn't stop having good moments just because they might show up.
You're right. Let's go put some tea on and share a few biscuits.
Tea and biscuits? I don't need to be told twice.
How about fried rabbit and ox tail soup? I could eat that all day long!

Fields.MenuText: I'm not much for meat dishes, Orion.
I've never had that combination, but if it's filling, I'm game.
I can't believe we have the same favorites!

Fields.DialogueText: Why not? Animals eat one another all the time. Why should we be any different?
Oh, you have no idea what you're missing! Next time we make port, I'll make sure the cook picks up the ingredients.
It is a pretty big coincidence.
*WOOF!*
It seems like Cappy agrees with you, Orion. Not that I would doubt a dog would like rabbit meat.
*WOOF!*
Or he's trying to alert us.
Of course.
@BATTLE
I don't know.
Ahhh, smell that fresh ocean air, Orion. What a day!
The weather is so temperate and beautiful here.
I never thought of how you might feel about the weather. Do heavy rains bother you?
I don't mind the rains so much. It's the snow that drives me crazy.
I would have figured, being from England, you would have been more used to the snow.
Oh, I've been around a lot of it, and I absolutely hate it! I wish I was born someplace warm, like Spain or Mexico.

Fields.MenuText: I love the cool. I couldn't imagine living anywhere too hot or too cold.
I love the sun too. This is paradise.
I'm the opposite. Give me ice and snow.

Fields.DialogueText: You have no idea how great it is to lay out in the sun and get a nice tan.
Maybe that's why we get along so well, Captain!
I can't fathom why.
Well, I'm glad the sun is out for you to enjoy. Soak it in - this nice weather will only last so long.
@BATTLE
Captain! It came today... it came!
Orion, compose yourself. This is still a Navy vessel.
Sorry, Captain. I'm just so excited.
What is it? I've never seen you jump around like this.
My love letter! I finally received a love letter from someone who truly understands me. I'm so excited, I just can't contain myself.
Is that so? Then this is quite the day for you.
Actually...
Actually?
Cappy got hold of the letter before I did. He chewed up the last page and I have no idea who wrote it.
Good grief. You really have no clue?
Well, the person knows my favorite flower, so that gives me a few ideas...

Fields.MenuText: I bet it's the cook. I saw how he gave you extra pudding at dinner last night!
That crew member that delivered your package of tea the other day seems to have taken a liking to you.
Maybe Cappy learned to write. He does seem like quite the smart puppy! Don't you boy, you're a smart puppy...

Fields.DialogueText: The cook is married to a wonderful woman back home. It was her lamb recipe he cooked for us on Monday.
I doubt it, since he seems to like the company of the other crewmen quite a bit.
Sure, make fun of me, Captain. But I'm going to identify my admirer before this war ends!
Well, I'm out of suggestions. Perhaps you'll get another letter and this time Cappy won't chew off the name.
Do you really think so, Captain? I can't wait to read what my admirer sends me next!
@BATTLE
Captain! You were right! I got another letter from my admirer.
Well, who is it from? Don't keep me in suspense.
I don't know - I haven't opened it yet. I was hoping you could do it for me. I'm too nervous to open it myself.
Hand it over. I'll open it up and find out whose heart has been smitten.
Cut it out with the fancy language and open this letter before I explode from excitement.
*ALARM*
It looks like you'll have to wait a bit longer to find out who the mystery person is, my lady. Leave it to the Morganas to spoil the best moment of your life.
@BATTLE
I couldn't wait for that battle to end. If it had lasted one more minute I was going to unleash my entire arsenal all at once!
So...

Fields.MenuText: Don't freak out, but I dropped the letter during the battle. I'm sure that wasn't the last letter from the mystery admirer.
Maybe you should have, because I lost the letter during the last salvo from the Morganas.
Perhaps you should have moved at half speed when you took that last turn, because I dropped the letter from the rocking of the ship.

Fields.DialogueText: What?!
What?!
What?!
Chin up, Orion. Tomorrow is a new day, and if this person really loves you, they will keep sending you letters.
For your sake, you'd better be right!
I hope you're right, or else you'll be searching for my letter at the bottom of the ocean!
Damn those Morganas. They keep ruining my love life. I used to dislike them before, but now I completely hate them!
I just wanted to get back here and find out who loves me as soon as possible! How could you lose my letter?
Orion, look what I found in the mess hall. Another letter from your secret admirer. Should I open it?
Open it! Open it, open it, open it! Quickly... before the Morganas show up and screw everything up.
All right! Let's see... undying love... beautiful, flowing hair... deep violet eyes... and that's it.
What?!
No name, sorry.
Really? Give me that letter...
*ALARM*
Do I have to say it? The mystery has to wait until after the battle. The Morganas' timing is spot on, as always.
@BATTLE
Well, that's another battle in the win column. Not that it matters much, since I'm no closer to finding out who my admirer is.

Fields.MenuText: Don't worry. We'll just have to content ourselves with having good moments until they reveal themselves.
Do you really want to be involved with someone who makes a game of this sort of thing?

Fields.DialogueText: That sounds like an excellent plan, Captain.
If you have someone better in mind, Captain, I'm all ears.
Damn, you're right. I wonder why my admirer didn't write their name on this letter.
